body.p: CASE.—Captain William H. Winsor, Co. F, 18th Massachusetts Volunteers, was wounded by a shell at the battle of Fredericksburg, December 13th, 1862, which fractured a portion of the left side of the cranium. He was admitted to the hospital of Griffin's division, Fifth Corps, and thence was sent to Washington for treatment. He resigned March 15th, 1863. The power of hearing was somewhat impaired.
